Labubu gained global fame after K-pop star Lisa of Blackpink was seen with a keychain. This sparked a viral trend. Pop Mart, the seller of Labubu, saw profits soar.

items.summary: This week, Prime Minister Narendra Modi concluded his fourth visit to Bhutan since 2014, India and Canada moved to reset their bilateral ties, and US President Donald Trump signalled a possible rethink of key policies affecting India.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc gets licence to explore, mine tungsten block in Andhra Pradesh

It aims to diversify its mineral portfolio beyond zinc, lead, and silver. The company is now set to contribute to India's self-reliance in critical minerals. This expansion marks a new chapter for Hindustan Zinc.

items.title: Kochi Metro bags national recognition for green transport leadership
items.summary: This recognition marks Kochi as the only city in India where all four organised modes of transport — air, land, rail, and water — operate successfully within a shared framework of clean energy and sustainability

items.title: Retail inflation likely to stay negative excluding gold; RBI faces policy dilemma: Report
items.summary: India's retail inflation, excluding gold, is predicted to stay negative for two more months. This low inflation environment, alongside strong GDP growth, poses a significant challenge for the Reserve Bank of India. The central bank must carefully balance supporting economic expansion with managing price stability. Upcoming economic data will guide future policy decisions.

items.summary: Microfinance institutions face a critical challenge in rebuilding trust and credibility for sustainable growth. Recent setbacks like demonetisation and the Covid pandemic have impacted repayment discipline and public confidence. Empowering customers with information and ensuring fair practices are vital. The industry is currently prioritizing portfolio health over aggressive expansion, but this approach is not sustainable long-term.

The dispute ended Friday, allowing fans to watch college football and other sports. Both companies had accused each other of unfair practices during negotiations. This marks another carriage dispute in the streaming world.

items.title: Apple ramps up India push as key vendors expand investments, boost local production and exports
items.summary: Apple's India vendors are significantly expanding their local operations, with some initiating production trials and exports. TD Connex plans a substantial investment for facility expansion, while Yuzhan Technology has begun exporting display modules from its new Tamil Nadu unit. These moves align with Apple's supply chain diversification beyond China.

items.title: Unilateral moves leading to reset in global trade: WTO director-general Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala
items.summary: WTO director-general Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala says the global trading system is undergoing a necessary reset amid rising unilateral actions and protectionism, yet remains surprisingly resilient with 72% of world trade still conducted on MFN terms. In an interview with ET, she highlighted the key reform agenda for 2026 ministerial conference, the need to modernise WTO rules for a changing world, and India’s central role in emerging opportunities—from services and digital trade to value-chain diversification.

items.title: Winter travel: Airfare freeze likely, but room rates may hot up
items.summary: This holiday season, travelers can expect stable airfares to popular destinations as airlines increase capacity. However, hotel rates are projected to rise significantly, with double-digit growth anticipated in many leisure spots.  This trend indicates a strong travel sentiment favoring premium accommodations despite affordable flights.

items.title: Big Family Offices Split on Oracle as Ellison’s Wealth Surged
items.summary: Investment firms for the world’s ultra-wealthy diverged over their stance on Oracle Corp. during a period when the US software giant’s stock rallied the most in more than three decades and briefly made Chairman Larry Ellison the richest person in the world.

items.title: Non-life insurers told to work closely with states, build trust

items.title: 'Lifestyle expansion in India may be hit next year': CEO Devarajan Iyer

Yet, the journey might encounter obstacles in the coming year, primarily due to a slowdown in the establishment of new premium malls by leading real estate players.

items.title: Directorate General of Trade Remedies moots anti-dumping duty on low-ash met coke
items.summary: Based on its preliminary findings, the DGTR has suggested anti-dumping duty ranging from $73.55 per tonne to $130.66 per tonne, depending on the country of export. The lowest anti-dumping duty rate has been recommended on imports from Australia and the highest on imports from China.

items.title: No justification to change CAFE  norm: Shailesh Chandra, MD & CEO of TMPV
items.summary: Tata Motors questioned proposals to redefine small cars by introducing weight as a criterion, arguing there's no justification for altering fuel efficiency norms or offering concessions. The company stated that encouraging lighter vehicles could compromise safety standards and undermine industry progress in protection. Tata Motors affirmed its ability to meet existing CAFE norms without special treatment.

items.title: India second-largest buyer of Russian crude in October: Report
items.summary: India's overall fossil-fuel imports from Russia reached 3.1 billion compared with China's 5.8 billion. At 2.7 billion, Turkiye ranked third, while the EU was the fourth largest importer at 1.1 billion.

items.title: Robust PV sales light up auto cos' October show with all-time high
items.summary: In October, the Indian automotive market hit an all-time high, with passenger vehicle wholesales climbing an impressive 17 percent. Two-wheeler sales followed suit, experiencing notable growth. This surge was fueled by vibrant festive shopping and a reduction in GST rates.

items.title: Wheat product export ban likely to be eased after good harvest

This move comes as India anticipates a bumper wheat crop in 2025-26, following a ban imposed in 2022 due to production concerns.

items.title: Toy story: US orders decline 50% as tariffs hit exporters
items.summary: Amidst rising tariffs, Indian toy exporters are grappling with a 50% drop in orders from the United States, prompting a shift in buyer interest towards competitors such as China and Vietnam. To remain competitive, exporters are adjusting by lowering prices and streamlining their designs.

items.title: India in FTA talks with US, EU & others: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: India is actively negotiating free trade agreements with the US, EU, New Zealand, Oman, Peru, and Chile, alongside existing pacts with the UAE, Australia, and EFTA. Minister Piyush Goyal emphasized lowering trade barriers and fostering transparency to encourage two-way investments during volatile global times. The government has also significantly reduced compliances and abolished laws to promote ease of doing business.

Experts suggest tax cuts and a favorable base effect also contributed to this deflationary trend.
